block.p: Weeks
This
On
Week
List
Fiction
MOONLIGHT BECOMES YOU, by Mary Higgins Clark. (Pocket, $7.99.) A fashion photographer investigates the mysterious death of a friend.
THE RAPTURE OF CANAAN, by Sheri Reynolds. (Berkley, $12.) The unexpected pregnancy of a young girl divides an evangelical community. (+)
MONTANA SKY, by Nora Roberts. (Jove, $6.99.) Three half sisters must live together for a year before they can inherit their father's ranch.
THE BLACKSTONE CHRONICLES: PARTS 1-5, by John Saul. (Fawcett, $2.99 each.) A serial horror tale set in a New England town.
SUDDEN PREY, by John Sandford. (Berkley, $6.99.) Lucas Davenport and his team of cops contend with robbers determined to kill them.
THE RUNAWAY JURY, by John Grisham. (Island/Dell, $7.99.) A woman sues a tobacco company for causing her husband's death.
PROMISES, by Belva Plain. (Dell, $7.50.) Two cousins have to make heartbreaking choices as their family is strained by passion and betrayal.
STONES FROM THE RIVER, by Ursula Hegi. (Scribner, $13.) A dwarf becomes the conscience of her German town during the Nazi era. (+)
SHE'S COME UNDONE, by Wally Lamb. (Washington Square/Pocket, $14.) A woman's harrowing progress from youth to middle age. (+)
INVASION, by Robin Cook. (Berkley, $6.99.) Coping with the sudden outbreak of a disease whose symptoms are new and defy analysis.
WHERE THE HEART IS, by Elizabeth Lowell. (Avon, $6.50.) The solitude being enjoyed by a woman following her divorce is intruded upon by a sensual traveling man.
THE LOST WORLD, by Michael Crichton. (Ballantine, $7.99.) Scientists visit a Costa Rican jungle that is the breeding ground of dinosaurs.
SEE HOW THEY RUN, by James Patterson. (Warner Vision, $6.99.) A physician looks for the secret behind a series of murders in his family.
SHADOWS OF STEEL, by Dale Brown. (Berkley, $6.99.) America wages high-tech warfare against Iran in the Persian Gulf.
NEANDERTHAL, by John Darnton. (St. Martin's, $7.99.) The discovery in northern Asia of a species of primitive protohumans that has existed for 40,000 years.
Weeks
This
On
Week
List
NonFiction
SPONTANEOUS HEALING, by Andrew Weil. (Fawcett, $12.95.) How the body heals itself. (+)
REVIVING OPHELIA, by Mary Pipher. (Ballantine, $12.50.) The dangers for teen-age girls. (+)
THE COLOR OF WATER, by James McBride. (Riverhead, $12.) A black writer and musician remembers his experiences growing up with his white mother in a Brooklyn housing project.
A CIVIL ACTION, by Jonathan Harr. (Vintage, $13.) A lawsuit brought by Massachusetts householders against industrial polluters. (+)
GIRLFRIENDS, by Carmen Renee Berry and Tamara Traeder. (Wildcat Canyon, $12.95.) The ties that bind women of all ages and all kinds.
INTO THE WILD, by Jon Krakauer. (Anchor/ Doubleday, $12.95.) How a young man's obsession with the wilderness had a tragic end.
*THE CLOISTER WALK, by Kathleen Norris. (Riverhead, $12.50.) A poet's experiences during two retreats at a monastery in Minnesota. (+)
*HOW COULD YOU DO THAT?! by Laura Schlessinger. (Harper Perennial, $13.) Self-indulgent morality, and ways to overcome it.
HOW THE IRISH SAVED CIVILIZATION, by Thomas Cahill. (Anchor/Doubleday, $12.95.) The story of monks who copied Western literature. (+)
OUTRAGE, by Vincent Bugliosi. (Island/Dell, $6.99.) The former prosecutor finds that justice was not served in the first O. J. Simpson trial. (+)
HITLER'S WILLING EXECUTIONERS, by Daniel Jonah Goldhagen. (Vintage, $16.) Did ordinary Germans cooperate in conducting the Holocaust?
THE LIARS' CLUB, by Mary Karr. (Penguin, $11.95.) A poet recalls her troubled childhood. (+)
THE DEMON-HAUNTED WORLD, by Carl Sagan. (Ballantine, $14.) The astronomer argues against dangerously unscientific beliefs.
NO SHIRT. NO SHOES. . . . NO PROBLEM! by Jeff Foxworthy. (Hyperion, $5.99.) Observations on life by the stand-up comedian from Georgia.
AN UNQUIET MIND, by Kay Redfield Jamison. (Vintage, $12.) A professor of psychiatry remembers her struggle with manic depression.
*THE SHELTER OF EACH OTHER, by Mary Pipher. (Ballantine, $12.95.) The pressures that imperil families today, and how to counter them.
Weeks
This
On
Week
List
Advice, How-To and Miscellaneous
CHICKEN SOUP FOR THE WOMAN'S SOUL, compiled by Jack Canfield, Mark Victor Hansen, Jennifer Read Hawthorne and Marci Shimoff. (Health Communications, $12.95.) Inspiration. (+)
A 4TH COURSE OF CHICKEN SOUP FOR THE SOUL. (Health Communications, $12.95.) More inspirational stories. (+)
DR. ATKINS' NEW DIET REVOLUTION, by Robert C. Atkins. (Avon, $6.50.) Ways to lose weight and achieve a healthy body.
CASUAL DAY HAS GONE TOO FAR, by Scott Adams. (Andrews & McMeel, $9.95.) A collection of ''Dilbert'' cartoons about contemporary life in the office.

Rankings reflect sales figures, for the week ending April 26, at 3,985 bookstores plus wholesalers serving 60,000 other retailers, statistically weighted to represent sales in all such outlets nationwide. An asterisk (*) indicates that a book's sales are barely distinguishable from those of the book above. A dagger (+) indicates that some bookstores report receiving bulk orders for a book.

PAPERBACK BEST SELLERS: May 11, 1997
